urls.title: Make-A-Wish (International) (Miles on a Mission)
urls.description: Help wishes take flight by donating your award miles to Make-A-Wish(r)! Make-A-Wish creates life-changing wishes for children with critical illnesses. We seek to bring every eligible childs wish to life because a wish is an integral part of a childs treatment journey. Research shows children who have wishes granted can build the physical and emotional strength they need to fight their illness. Make-A-Wish is the worlds leading childrens wish-granting organization, serving children in more than 50 countries worldwide. Together, generous donors, supporters, staff and more than 40,000 volunteers grant a wish every 17 minutes, on average, somewhere in the world. Since 1980, Make-A-Wish has granted nearly 450,000 wishes to children; more than 30,000 last year alone. For more information about Make-A-Wish International, visit worldwish.org. Donated miles can help make wishes come true around the world, and the best part is that donated miles never expire. Thank you for helping to grant life-

data.text: Want to go the extra mile for us this #GivingTuesday? Today only, when you donate MileagePlus miles to Make-A-Wish International, @united Airlines will match you, mile for mile, up to 100,000 miles. Donate your miles here: https://t.co/jwbhaqVT2P https://t.co/AhrioHDmu3

urls.title: The Pacific Pediatric Neuro-oncology Consortium (PNOC)
urls.description: PNOC is accelerating research for the deadliest cancer for children through innovative open-source global collaboration with doctors and researchers, as well as pediatric brain cancer patient families around the world. Miles on a Mission will help PNOC's doctors and researchers bring hope and breakthrough treatment options to more children and young adults with brain cancer. About us Brain cancer is the deadliest cancer for children. The Pacific Pediatric Neuro-oncology Consortium (PNOC) brings together the world's best clinicians and researchers to find a cure for pediatric brain cancers by translating the latest findings in brain tumor biology into better treatments for children. PNOC is a consortium with a global presence with study sites in the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Switzerland, The Netherlands, Israel and India. PNOC Foundation's vision is to lose no child to brain cancer, and to improve the quality of life for those fighting and surviving pediatric brain

data.text: It’s #GivingTuesday, and today when you donate MileagePlus miles to PNOC Foundation, @united will match you, mile for mile.
